alert.note: Alert for Eastern Essex (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 23 at 3:57PM EST by NWS Burlington
info.description: ...Band Of Moderate Snow And Reduced Visibility Continues... A slow moving band of moderate snow and reduced visibility will continue across portions of Essex County New York and the northwest and central portions of Vermont through 600 pm. Areas most likely to see this band of snow produce an inch or less of snow in a short period of time and visibility reduced under a mile include eastern Essex County in New York as well as Chittenden, Lamoille, Addison, Washington, and Orange counties in Vermont. The band of snow has produced visibility as low as a quarter mile and up to a half inch of snow in a short period of time. Precautionary/Preparedness Actions... Remember conditions can deteriorate rapidly in winter weather situations. Be prepared for snow covered roads and reduced visibilities. Slow down and allow extra time when traveling.
